text: Not sure if my review is fair because we went on a random Sunday without booking. This restaurant was preparing for some CNY group booking then. So we went in and they have nice dinosaurs and animals outside, and yes not many are left. So we went in. We ordered the Puâ€™er teapot ($13), Signature Hor Fun ($14) and crispy noodle ($7). The service was good as the uncle was humble and asked for our every need. And their last order was 3pm. The crispy noodle had some not so good vegetables but signature hor fun was good as it came with many great stuff. Highly recommended to eat this. The tea was fine. Toilet is pretty exotic cos they designed it with old Chinese shophouse doors but it was all dampy so pls avoid wearing bridal gowns there.

Superb environment with friendly staff! A hidden short getaway located in Mandai area. Pet-friendly but have to dine outdoor with live chicken. Unfortunately not much of the dinosaurs or animal figures left. After dining, there is a cosy KTV lounge where you can spent your entire evening there.

A nice quiet beer garden with good ambience
located on a slope call Mandai Hill in a rural area of Singapore.Access by car is from a road call Mandai Estate.Parking is free within their premises.Also reachable by public buses , just alight at Woodlands Road, then a short walk up the small slope of road call Mandai Estate and on the left is Cafe 566 Beer Garden.Also next to the beer garden is the 566 Seafood Restaurant.
Dated : 22/01/2018 ( Monday ).

The attitude of the staff is very bad. When the boss around, they will not dare to click their songs. When the boss leaves, they will click on their songs to sing and take turn with us. Without a smile and fierce face to us.When songs in our turn ,they will not automatically give us a microphone.
Unassuming from outside, but inside is massive. Food is good, we had the chili crabs :)
